Triptych Shawl

$6.00 • Buy Triptych Shawl now! Pattern Purchase FAQ View on Ravelry

I have a love/hate relationship with beads, and I decided there had to be a way to use beads as a mild accent, with an option to add more, that wouldn’t make your neck freeze. Here it is: a shawl with beads on the emphasized edging, and that’s it. The light, breezy stitch motif is perfect for summer knitting, and is easily worked without beads.

Knit from tip-to-tip, this scarf is intentionally asymmetrical. It is worked with increase, straight, and decrease sections.

You can place additional beads at your discretion, you will need approximately 14 grams of size 6 glass beads to place all of the beads listed in the pattern.

The pattern is written in a table format, with each column divider representing a marker (markers are still written intro the instructions as a friendly reminder).

If you’re new to knitting with beads, an excellent beading tutorial is available in the Spring 2006 edition of Knitty.

Pattern Information

Gauge

22 stitches and 26 rows = 4 inches in Stockinette stitch

Yardage

400 - 420 yards Fingering / 4 ply (14 wpi)

Yarns

Little Red Bicycle Spark (Fingering)

Needles

0.6 mm

Sizes

60"/152cm wingspan 20"/51 cm deep

Photos

About pattern purchases

Patterns are sold as downloadable PDF files through Ravelry, with payments processed by PayPal. You do not need an account to use either service.

If you have a Ravelry account, I suggest logging in prior to purchasing so that patterns are added to your library.

Get pattern help

Pattern support is provided free of charge for all of my patterns. We respond as quickly as possible, but sometimes it can take a day or two.

Submit a new help request through Zendesk.

You can also use Zendesk to report errors and ask non-technical questions.

Alternatively, you can try the Ravelry group.

Support is only provided via Zendesk.

FAQ

Can I teach a class using your knitting pattern?

Teaching licensing is temporarily on hold and should resume in 2014.

Can I sell items made using your knitting patterns for profit or charity?

Not at this time.

How do I order wholesale copies for my LYS?

Pattern wholesaling is temporarily on hold and should resume in 2014.

I found an error, how do I report it?

Oh newts! Submit your error through Zendesk and we will fix it.

Happy knitting!
